    • Constructor Detail

      • MagicSquare

        public MagicSquare(int order,
                   java.lang.String initialEdge,
                   int[] orientation)
            throws OutOfRangeOrderException,
                   InvalidInitialEdgeException,
                   InvalidOrientationException
        The constructor allows to obtain an instance of an odd order MagicSquare
        Parameters:
        order - The order of the magic square to generate
        order%2 != 0 && order > 0
        initialEdge - The position at where the matrix begins to fill
        This parameter should be FIRS_ROW, LAST_ROW, FIRST_COLUMN or LAST_COLUMN
        orientation - The direction in which the matrix will be filled
        This parameter should be NO, SO, NE or SE
        Throws:
        OutOfRangeOrderException - if the order does not meet the above conditions
        InvalidInitialEdgeException - if the initial edge is not one of the valid values described above
        InvalidOrientationException - if orientation is not one of the valid values described above

    • Method Detail

      • getOrder

        public int getOrder()
        The method allows to obtain the magic square order
        Returns:
        The order of the magic square

      • setOrder

        public void setOrder(int order)
              throws OutOfRangeOrderException
        The method allows to modify the magic square order
        Parameters:
        order - The new order order%2 != 0 && order > 0
        Throws:
        OutOfRangeOrderException - if the order does not meet the above conditions

      • getInitialEdge

        public java.lang.String getInitialEdge()
        The method allows to obtain the magic square initial filling position
        Returns:
        The magic square initial filling position

      • setInitialEdge

        public void setInitialEdge(java.lang.String initialEdge)
                    throws InvalidInitialEdgeException
        The method allows to modify the magic square initial filling position
        Parameters:
        initialEdge - The new magic square initial filling position
        This parameter should be FIRS_ROW, LAST_ROW, FIRST_COLUMN or LAST_COLUMN
        Throws:
        InvalidInitialEdgeException - if the initial edge is not one of the valid values described above

      • getOrientation

        public int[] getOrientation()
        The method allows to obtain the direction in which the magic square is filled
        Returns:
        A vector that indicates the direction in which the magic square is filled

      • setOrientation

        public void setOrientation(int[] orientation)
                    throws InvalidOrientationException
        The method allows to modify the direction in which the magic square will be filled
        Parameters:
        orientation - The new orientation of filling This parameter should be NO, SO, NE or SE
        Throws:
        InvalidOrientationException - if orientation is not one of the valid values described above

      • getMagicalSum

        public int getMagicalSum()
        The method allows to obtain the magical sum of this magic square
        It is the number that adds each row, column and diagonal of the magic square
        Returns:
        The magical sum of this magic square based on its order

      • generateMagicSquare

        public int[][] generateMagicSquare()
                            throws LoubereMethodNotSatisfiedException
        The method allows to generate a magic square according to this MagicSquare attributes
        Returns:
        A matrix of integers that represents this magic square
        Throws:
        LoubereMethodNotSatisfiedException - if both initialEdge and orientation don't make the indexes to get out of the matrix in the first filling move

      • correctIndex

        private int correctIndex(int index)
        The method receives an integer as a parameter that represents the current position of the row or column and, if it is outside the limits of the matrix, returns the position in which it should be
        Parameters:
        index - The current row or column index
        Returns:
        The position where the index should be
